brief_description: Scotland's capital blends medieval Old Town lanes, elegant Georgian squares, and volcanic landscapes into one of Europe's most atmospheric cities.

sections.title: Historic Layers
sections.content: Centuries of history sit side by side on the Royal Mile, where closes, wynds, and hidden courtyards connect Edinburgh Castle with Holyrood Palace.

sections.title: Festival Capital
sections.content: From the world-famous Fringe and International Festival to Hogmanay fireworks, Edinburgh's calendar overflows with cultural celebrations.

sections.title: Storybook Landscapes
sections.content: Arthur's Seat, Calton Hill, and the Water of Leith offer dramatic vistas and outdoor adventures within minutes of bustling streets.

sections.title: Creative Dining
sections.content: Modern Scottish chefs champion seasonal produce, whisky pairings, and fresh North Sea seafood alongside traditional favorites like haggis and Cullen skink.

why_visit.intro: Edinburgh charms travelers with layers of history, a thriving arts scene, and rugged natural backdrops that inspire exploration year-round.

highlights.title: Edinburgh Castle
highlights.content: Perched on Castle Rock, the fortress houses the Honours of Scotland and sweeping views across the city.

highlights.title: Royal Mile
highlights.content: Medieval closes, folk tales, whisky bars, and artisan shops connect the castle with Holyrood Palace.

highlights.title: Festival Season
highlights.content: August brings the Fringe, International Festival, and Military Tattoo, turning the city into a global stage.

highlights.title: Natural Escapes
highlights.content: Climb Arthur's Seat at sunrise, stroll Dean Village along the Water of Leith, or watch sunsets from Calton Hill.

highlights.title: Scottish Flavors
highlights.content: Sample whisky flights, hearty seafood chowders, and contemporary tasting menus celebrating Scottish larder.

highlights.title: Museums & Galleries
highlights.content: Discover Scottish history at the National Museum, masterpieces at the National Galleries, and writers at the Writers' Museum.

transport.public_transport: Lothian Buses and Edinburgh Trams offer comprehensive coverage with contactless payments and capped daily fares.
transport.passes: Consider a Ridacard or day ticket for unlimited tram and bus travel; trains connect easily to Glasgow and the Highlands.

spring.description: Cherry blossom lines The Meadows, festivals return, and mild weather invites Old Town walks and day trips to the Borders.

summer.description: Festival season fills streets with performers, fireworks, and late sunsets while nearby beaches offer breezy escapes.

autumn.description: Golden foliage blankets Princes Street Gardens and Arthur's Seat while whisky bars glow with warm light.

winter.description: Hogmanay celebrations, twinkling lights on George Street, and cozy pubs make the dark season atmospheric and festive.

january.title: Warm up with a whisky tasting
january.description: Join a guided flight at the Scotch Whisky Experience and learn the story of the Highlands and Islands.

february.title: Explore the National Museum of Scotland
february.description: Hands-on galleries and the roof terrace offer a winter-friendly day out.

march.title: Walk the Water of Leith
march.description: Spot herons and historic mills along the 12km riverside path between Balerno and Leith.

april.title: Picnic beneath The Meadows blossom
april.description: Locals celebrate spring by gathering under the park's cherry trees.

may.title: Climb Arthur's Seat at sunrise
may.description: Enjoy panoramic views as the city lights fade and daylight stretches.

june.title: Tour the Royal Botanic Garden
june.description: Guided walks highlight Victorian glasshouses and Scottish plant collections.

july.title: Attend the International Jazz & Blues Festival
july.description: Music spills into venues across Old Town ahead of Fringe season.

august.title: Experience the Edinburgh Festival Fringe
august.description: Catch comedy, theatre, and experimental performances around every corner.

september.title: Take a day trip to the Borders
september.description: Visit Rosslyn Chapel and Melrose Abbey amid autumn colors.

october.title: Join a ghost tour of the Old Town
october.description: Explore haunted closes and hidden vaults with costumed storytellers.

november.title: Watch fireworks on Calton Hill
november.description: Bonfire Night illuminations pair with stunning skyline views.

december.title: Browse Edinburgh's Christmas Market
december.description: Festive stalls, mulled wine, and a Ferris wheel take over Princes Street Gardens.
